intro: Commersonia bartramia var. tahitensis, commonly known as the Tahitian bartramia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the island of Tahiti and is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It has small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. This variety is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
